intro: Osteospermum pterigoideum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are showy, with bright yellow centers surrounded by white to pinkish petals, blooming from spring to autumn. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
